body_html: Picking up this old thread, a question: why don't you use make_template and have three queues feeding into three automatically shared model graphs? True, you still need to keep track when an epoch ends and switch over to the e.g. validation queue, but this can be done rather simple by either counting or have the queues return an additional element (additional wrt inputs and targets) that indicates one full pass through the data (training or validation data) is done. Or is this approach considered harmful in some way?
